hints_html: What is the dimension of A? Initially, all entries are 0. How many entries are changed in total? Which?
hints_latex:
What is the dimension of \emph{A}? Initially, all entries are 0. How
many entries are changed in total? Which?
hints_raw: What is the dimension of ''A''? Initially, all entries are 0. How many entries are changed in total? Which?
question: A 13
sols_html:
The first line of code creates the 3 by 3 zeros matrix:

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

Then we enter the for-loop. In the first iteration, the entry A(1,1) is set to -5 and A(1,2) is set to 1, resulting in

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} {\color{green} -5} & {\color{green} 1} & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0\end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

In the second iteration the entry A(2,2) is set to -5 and A(2,3) is set to 1, hence

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} -5 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & {\color{green} -5} & {\color{green} 1} \\ 0 & 0 & 0\end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

Finally, the entry A(3,3) is set to -2. So the final answer is

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} -5 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -5 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The first line of code creates the 3 by 3 zeros matrix:

:<math> A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right] </math>

Then we enter the for-loop. In the first iteration, the entry ''A(1,1)'' is set to ''-5'' and ''A(1,2)'' is set to ''1'', resulting in

:<math> A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} {\color{green} -5} & {\color{green} 1} & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right] </math>

In the second iteration the entry ''A(2,2)'' is set to ''-5'' and ''A(2,3)'' is set to ''1'', hence

:<math> A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} -5 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & {\color{green} -5} & {\color{green} 1} \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right] </math>

Finally, the entry ''A(3,3)'' is set to ''-2''. So the final answer is

:<math> A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} -5 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -5 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 \end{array}\right] </math>
statement_html:
Write the matrix A that would result from the following lines of MATLAB code:

A = zeros(3,3);
for i=1:2
 A(i,i) = -5;
 A(i,i+1) = 1;
end
A(3,3) = -2;
